page.title: 18Money systems in Willenhall
page.content:
Since 1971 there has been a decimal system of currency.100 pence equals one pound.Coins represented the following denominations: one half penny,1 penny,2 pence,5 pence,10 pence and 50 pence.Paper notes represented 1 pound(Â£),Â£5,Â£10,Â£20 and Â£50.Later a 20 pence coin was introduced and in 1985 the half penny coin has been taken out of circulation and a Â£1 coin has been brought in.This is due to inflation which is currently 7%.Here is an example of some prices in Willenhall.An average weekly wage is about Â£100.
Pint of beer 68p Margarine 33p Petrol(gallon) Â£1.98 Milk(pint) 22p Loaf of bread 39p Prescription Â£2 Dozen eggs 72p TV licence Â£58
